featured.text: Which of the following statements is true about how the glass armonica works? (A) Water has to be poured into the glass hemispheres. (B) Colored paint makes it sound better and last longer.
The skill of playing the glass armonica was very hard to master.
He invented an instrument for which both Mozart and Beethoven composed music—the glass armonica.
Music was moving out of the relatively small halls of Mozart’s day into the large concert halls of the 19th century, and without amplification, the glass armonica simply couldn’t be heard.

other.text: Concert reviews from the period mourned the fact that the armonica sounded wonderful—only when it could be heard.
According to the passage, why did the glass armonica lose its popularity? (A)

definition.zh_def: 一種小型的樂器，通常由金屬簧片和木製或塑料外殼組成，通過吹氣或吸氣來發出音樂。
definition.en_def: A small musical instrument consisting of a series of metal reeds and a wooden or plastic casing, played by blowing or drawing air through it.
definition.example: He played a beautiful melody on his harmonica.
